intro: Maytenus brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited mayten, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by small, spherical fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and disturbed areas.
